channel.title: My cmd cant find java after i fixed the inviormental variable. [still need help]
channel.description:
im trying to make the source and the client connect..but it wont run i get this when i tryed running the "all" cmd and i got this..could u please help me?
The system cannot find the path specified. javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\players\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\players\update\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\players\items\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\players\combat\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\io\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\io\packets\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\net\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\util\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\world\mapdata\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options javac: file not found: .\bulby\rs2\world\items\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
ok now i dont have anyconnection with my cmd with jav NOW.i did everything else just like i was told about the inviormental variable and how to change the PATH,AND CLASSPATH.even after i fixed it their still remains to be a problem some how.

item.source: My cmd cant find java after i fixed the inviormental variable. [still need help]

item.title: My cmd cant find java after i fixed the inviormental variable. [still need help]
item.dc:creator: @hippo429 hippo429
item.description:
@hippo429 wrote:

to redirect javac you must go to program files and everything you click on is in the code…

Ex

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

ok lets break it down

"C:\Program Files\

i went to program files

Java\

then i clicked java

jdk1.6.0_14\

then jdk

bin\

bin

javac.exe" *.java

and finaly javac

so search for javac and make a path like that of all the places you went

Read full topic

you just gotta read and use common sense… it cant find javac… javac is in the JDK bin and it runs it… so the path you set is wrong because it cant find javac so go through your JDK and find the correct path so it can find javac
